page.title: 05BRIGHSTONE CHURCH HALL
page.content: The village hall in Brighstone is named after Wilberforce who abolished slavery. It is a large building. It is very spacious inside and at one end there is a small kitchen and toilets for ladies and gentlemen. The floor of the hall is made of wood and there is a badminton court marked on it. Badminton is played regularly here, sometimes people come over from the mainland for matches! Other uses for this very busy hall are for parish coucil meetings,jumble sales, fairs, fetes and the children's play group. Once a year children from the local Primary school perform their play on the stage here. Every week a lady comes to check the lights and to see generally that everything is alright.
